required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Open Label, Phase 1b, Ascending Dose Study of DM199
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label, Phase 1b, Single CENTER, Ascending Dose Study TO ASSESS THE SAFETY AND TOLERABILITY of DM199 With a Comparative Pharmacokinetic Study of DM199 Administered Intravenously and a Bioavailability Assessment of Subcutaneous Administration of DM199 in Normal Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 1B study to assess the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of DM199 in healthy volunteers. The study will be consist of two parts: Part A will focus on intravenous dosing and Part B will directly compare intravenous dosing with subcutaneous dosing.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v4.0
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of safety of intravenous dosing

secondary_outcome.description: Assess drug associated biomarkers (e.g. plasma bradykinin levels)

link.description: Safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetic profile of recombinant human tissue kallikrein, DM199, after intravenous and subcutaneous administration in healthy volunteers
